name: Las Marismas de Corralejo

reviews.text: Hotel was lovely and rooms were big with a separate bathroom and large kitchen/sitting room. The reception staff could have been a bit friendlier but the hotel ground etc were lovely. One pool heated and not too crowded. Lovely kids pool which our 2 year old loved and great play park/sand pit to keep him occupied for a while. Super market was well stocked but not open long enough - closed at 7pm and because it was a walk to the nearest big one it did get a bit annoying if you needed something in the afternoon and it was closed between 1pm and 4pm as well. The walk to the beach and the town centre was about 10/15 minutes.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but a bit out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No real criticism from either of us, unless your choice of holiday destination is influenced by petty complaints from folk moaning about a noisy chair.. or a lightly soiled sun lounger cushion... or not a lot to do apart from lay in the sun…(it’s the Canary Islands for god’s sake) then I suggest if you are considering staying in Corralejo you need look no further.
reviews.title: £500 Half board for 2 adults... At Christmas, get saving and give it a try!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The transfer from the airport took approx 30 minutes, mostly along the coastline. There are quite a lot of redundant building sites situated in and around Corralejo, this is no different to all of the Islands resorts, I stayed in Caleta de Fuste in March, Corralejo is similar in many ways but I preferred this location for the vast beaches nearby. The ‘STRIP’ is approx a 10min walk from the hotel, there is an array of Chinese buffet style restaurants along with Steakhouses, Cafés, Fresh(ish) looking Fish restaurants and Irish run pubs! If you’ve watched Benidorm I’m sure you get the picture, not sleazy in anyway at all it was a great place to go for a few drinks during the day or night time or both! There are also a handful of extremely tasty Tapas bars in the back streets running parallel to the main street.
reviews.title: Great for a family holiday but not for young couples/singles

reviews.text: We had several walks around the town and noticed a dozen or more of the other hotel options in the resort, the Marismas was visually by far the most appealing, even the 5* Bahia Real looked in serious need of an ‘external’ makeover. I must admit though the beach is definitely NOT nearby, unless the reviewers who claim it is are referring to the bus that takes you to it! This picks up outside the hotel at 11am and returns around 3pm (even on Xmas day), 2 euros return per person to a fantastic beach a few km away, well worth a visit. The town beach however was not particularly appealing, I don’t care if your Paula Radcliff it is at least a 20-25 minutes walk.
reviews.title: good place for families and sun worshippers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food options at breakfast were plentiful and every evening there was half a dozen options from the hot buffet, mountains of salads and desserts, the chef’s on a morning and in the evening were very friendly, as were ALL of the waiting staff and reception. Drinks were reasonably priced in the hotel and in the town, ranging from €1.50 to €4.00 for a pint and similar for most wines. Cocktails were quite expensive, obviously dependant on where you drank and the time of day. €7 for a Mojito I thought was a bit OTT.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money for accomadation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just arrived back from this hotel and we were really impressed with it!! The hotel was beautiful and there were lots of facilities on site. The gym and mini golf were free for everyone staying there, which was a good bonus. The pool areas were stunning and there were plenty of sunbeds.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: The rooms were very spacious and kept clean throughout the week by the cleaners.
reviews.title: Ideal hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great and the staff were extremely helpful, providing us with lots of useful information when checking in.
reviews.title: WHAT FANTASTIC SPOT!!!

reviews.text: We paid a little bit more than we normally would for this hotel, but the extra money was well worth it!!
reviews.title: Good value for money however...

reviews.text: I would recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: best place to be stuck

reviews.text: Family went for 2weeks self catering. Room was clean and lots of space but only a ceiling fan in bedroom, no air condition. too hot at night and day, Kids went to pool. my son was not happy as a broken tile went into his heel. Took it to lifeguard the broken tile and nothing was done about it. Really need a car to get about. 10 minutes drive to beaches from hotel. We only enjoyed being at the beaches most of our holiday. Also at night at hotel there hardly any entertaiment for the kids. Boring!!! Our last day we took a taxi to airport, never again get a bus, always late!!!!! Hottest was 37'c,
reviews.title: more effort needed

reviews.text: Las Marismas is close to town (10 mins walk). 15 mins to the small seaport (ferries to lanzarote - 27 euros) and the restaurants in old town (the town, like most Canary islands towns is small). Just across the road is a large mini golf (3.5 euros) and the waterpark - (20 euros per person all day or 15 euros after 3pm in October (although they let us off 1 person in 3 when we said we were from Las Marismas). Also close to open market held on Monday and one other day.
reviews.title: Superb holiday - better than expected"
Excellent hotel for money
reviews.text: Weather in Oct was 27 - 30 degrees with a nice onshore breeze to cool it down. We had an 84 year old and at no point was a cardigan necessary! Also had 2 teenagers and the free onsite minigolf, the larger offsite minigolf, the waterpark and the 3 pools were enough to keep them occupied.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms - very spacious and clean. Sheets and towels changed 5 days out of 7 (not Sun/Weds). No aircon! but we didn't need it - the temperature tended to be perfect. All the necessary - towels, kettle, fridge, microwave in the room.
reviews.title: Astonishing Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Felt completely safe in hotel and walking around.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.text: I concur with previous reviews which have stated overall an excellent place to stay – and great value for money. For me there were no major issues – however there were some minor service issues that prevented an overall 5 star rating. The biggest of these was undoubtedly the lack of air conditioning – and this coupled with the only ventilation being through the patio doors meant that even in November the apartment was very warm especially at night.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: Other minor issues included:
reviews.title: Not far off being a 4 star hotel

reviews.text: • Lights not working in apartment.
reviews.title: Perfect for us

reviews.text: • No kettle (but microwave and pans!).
reviews.title: Excellent
Great getaway great value for money
reviews.text: • No tables laid at breakfast two days in a row – so it was hunt the cutlery – and clear up last users dirty crockery.

aka: Las Marismas De Corralejo Hotel Corralejo
description: Las Marismas de Corralejo, enjoy the luminous apartments, with spacious terraces and balconies, as well as the Canarian and International food we offer in our restaurant. Enjoy our spectacular pools, all surrounded by beautiful gardens that imitate different elements of the landscape of Fuerteventura.
